intro: Byttneria cristobaliana, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical tree native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a fruit with a thick, fibrous rind and a sweet, juicy pulp that contains numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value. The plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
